newsitem.title: USA: World bond demand spurs GMAC $1 bln deal - exec.
newsitem.headline: World bond demand spurs GMAC $1 bln deal - exec.

text.p: General Motors Acceptance Corp, the financial services subsidiary of General Motors Corp, is raising $1 billion in its first global bond offering in order to access particularly favorable borrowing rates in the world credit markets, according to a high-level GMAC financing official.
GMAC has sold debt in both the domestic and international market in the past, but this is the company's first offering which simultaneously targets investors around the globe, he said.
The offering was priced a few minutes ago.
"Market conditions around the world are excellent and demand for corporate bonds is exceptional so we decided on (our first) global offering," the official said.

"Previous unsecured offerings have been smaller in size," he said. "Typically, global deals are larger as world investors like the liquidity of a large deal. This will become the benchmark for investors all over the world."
The offering of $1 billion in five-year non-callable senior unsecured notes is being joint-lead managed by Merrill Lynch & Co and J.P. Morgan Securities Inc.
GMAC has also selected 11 underwriters from around the world as co-lead managers, the official noted.
The bonds will be registered in the U.S. and listed on the Luxembourg stock exchange and will trade in markets around the world, he said.
